**Government Tender Announcement: Open Construction Source List for Defence Construction Canada**

**Reference Number:** MX-22631056461
**Solicitation Number:** PR22SLCH
**Publication Date:** 2022-12-05
**Tender Closing Date:** 2026-03-31T19:00:00

**Introduction:**
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites contractors and suppliers to apply for placement on the Open Construction Source List (OCSL) for commercial, residential, industrial, institutional, and civil work required by the Department of National Defence at ASU Chilliwack, BC. The OCSL is intended for construction services with an estimated value of $10 million and below.

**Selection Criteria:**
To be considered for the OCSL, interested contractors and suppliers must submit a request through the MERX posting, indicating their preferred official language (English or French). The selected language will be the only language used for tender documents, contract documents, and communication throughout the duration of the OCSL.

**Application Process:**
Applicants must have an active MERX account to submit electronic bids. Contractors and suppliers are encouraged to submit their request as soon as possible, preferably by January 15, 2023. DCC requires ten (10) business days to process an application for the OCSL.

**Tender Requirements:**
The OCSL will be used to tender construction services with an estimated value of $10 million and below. DCC will invite contractors and suppliers on the OCSL to bid on available opportunities. Tenders will close electronically through MERX.

**Security Requirements:**
All contracts tendered and awarded by DCC may contain organization and personnel security requirements. Contractors will be required to actively hold all required security clearances at the time of closing. DCC may publish Advance Procurement Notices (APNs) identifying potential tenders with anticipated security requirements.

**Code of Conduct and Evaluation:**
All contracts awarded by DCC include measurable performance standards and requirements. Contractors that receive an unacceptable or failing score may be removed from the OCSL and receive no further invitations.

**Other:**
DCC reserves the right to:

* Continue using existing source lists
* Establish other source lists for specific categories of construction services
* Verify contractors and suppliers on the OCSL
* Require additional pre-qualification requirements
* Post tenders openly on MERX
* Set aside tenders for Indigenous businesses
* Include a requirement for sub-contracting to Indigenous
